text: I decided to pursue music, so I dropped out of school and I told my parents I didn't want any money from them. I got three jobs and I just hit the ground running.
author: Lady Gaga

text: A lot of people in the media, and some everyday people, really aren't in search of the truth. They're in search of something worse than that. Money, yeah. I think the media's the kind of a thing where the truth doesn't win, because it's no fun. The truth's no fun.
author: Jack White

text: If someone decides to be a musician now, it means because there is no hope of money at the end of it, it means they really want to be a musician. And if someone is writing now, there is no hope for money at the end of it.
author: Doug Coupland

text: I think money is due for some sort of collapse. People are going to realize that money has a half-life, like radioactive elements.
author: Doug Coupland

text: I am not a pig farmer. The pigs had a great time, but I didn't make any money.
author: Willie Nelson
